title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer are practicing at second and third base during Red Sox spring training in Fort Myers.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora aims to soon decide Durbin's and Mayer's roles in the infield for the 2026 season.
Boston introduced Durbin and Mayer as top candidates for 3B, while exploring multiple infield options for flexibility.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant will remain with New England, declining interviews for offensive coordinator positions.
Grant significantly contributed to QB Drake Maye's development, who nearly won the NFL MVP for the 2025 season.
Grant, originally from Manchester, Conn., played at Assumption University and began coaching at Holy Cross in 2019.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton community raises over $25,000 through GoFundMe for Matt's Barber Shop after flood damage.
A burst pipe caused significant water damage to Matt's Barber Shop, owned by Matt Charette, in Brighton.
A benefit show is scheduled for February 19 with local bands to support the recovery of the barbershop.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity' starring Elizabeth Olsen is now available to stream on Apple TV.
'Dawson's Creek', featuring James Van Der Beek, streams on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi.
'Love Is Blind' Season 10 is currently streaming on Netflix.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge ruled two books on gender stereotypes aren't part of a Lexington father's lawsuit over LGBTQ-friendly lessons.
Judge Saylor's order specified only LGBTQ+ related lessons, not books like 'Pink Is For Boys' addressing gender stereotypes.
The father's lawsuit focuses on gender identity and gay rights, claiming these lessons go against his Christian values.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony, 21, will join Team USA in the World Baseball Classic pending a physical, replacing Corbin Carroll.
Anthony's physical will determine his eligibility; he last played in September due to an oblique injury.
Garrett Whitlock is the only other Red Sox player on Team USA; the Classic starts March 5.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Ocean House penthouse in Westerly, RI is listed at $20 million, making it one of the region's priciest properties.
The 4,696 sq ft penthouse includes three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and access to luxury amenities like a private beach.
Ocean House offers exclusive club memberships with access to a lap pool, spa, wine cellar, and other luxury facilities.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record, boosted by Jaylen Brown's 29.3 points per game.
Boston's most-used lineup has a strong 16.8 net rating, significantly higher than last season's lineup, indicating improved performance.
The Celtics face issues in clutch games, holding a 12-14 record, the worst among current playoff-positioned teams.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers museum visits, outdoor activities, and breweries during winter months, making it a year-round destination.
Visitors can enjoy hiking trails, snowshoeing, and cross-country skiing in places like Nickerson State Park.
Restaurants and breweries, such as Devil’s Purse Brewing Company and Bamboo Chinese Cuisine, provide local dining experiences.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, a pharmacist from North Carolina, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon for Breakthrough T1D.
Lapczynski, diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes 23 years ago, will run to support life-changing research and advocacy.
Her participation honors her mother's recent T1D diagnosis and aims to inspire others to chase dreams despite diabetes.
